data.title: Rumors  (Fleetwood Mac Tribute)
data.text: This was my first time at CDEC. I did not realize that General Admission was ALL STANDING. Of course you could rent a small table for $20. Seemed like a safety concern for all standing. You could upgrade to balcony seating up top. The whole event seemed disorganized. Did not realize there was a warm up act. The event was supposed to start at 9. The warm up act started around 8:45 and went til 9:30. Rumors started at 10. We stood outside inline at 7:45 and was really disappointed to have to wait so long. I realized bands start late, but seemed way too long between acts. The warm up act was 1 guy and a guitar!! Not sure why it would take 30 minutes in between. The band was very good and the sound was good, but because we drove over an hour we only stayed about 30 minutes because it was getting late. They should rename the theater to Cone Denim BAR.  I knew there would be alcohol but they need to be more organized about the seating and the check in process. I guess I am one of the few that actually go to a Rock concert to enjoy the music and be entertained without alcohol consumption. I guess that's why they start so late because people drink more as its gets later. Will probably not go back there anytime soon. I will pay extra to have a "reserved" seat and go somewhere where safety and security is a priority.

data.title: Great Concert
data.text: We went to a great concert. The staff was nice and very helpful. Nice place to go and listen to music. Makes you feel like they right in your house, playing just for you. Loved it. Thanks for a great time.

data.title: First time visit..
data.text:
Small venue in a small town. I traveled short of two hours to attend a charity concert put on by a local country music station.

Seemed like a really nice complex for music. All I encountered was a single stall bathroom, which can be frustrating and cause lines for those needing to "empty the tank."

Beer prices were $9 at this event for the big boy cans. Salty, but for most music venues this seems to run average.

data.title: Buckcherry on July 19th
data.text: We made our first visit to Cone Denim on 7/19/16 to see Buckcherry.  That is a great place to see a small show.  The sound was good and the staff was great.  Our tickets were in the balcony, and we had plenty of room and a great view.  Just a quick tip, if you have difficulty climbing stairs you might want to get tickets for the main floor.  The stairs were pretty steep and I didn't see another way up to the balcony (I could be wrong about this, since we didn't really take time to look around).

data.title: GREAT VENUE
data.text: We absolutely love this venue! The sound is great and the staff is always friendly. If you're thinking about going to a concert there you should purchase General Admission seats and then upgrade to one of the tables on the floor, it comes with a cocktail waitress so you don't have to wait at the bars to be served.

data.title: Excellent Venue!
data.text: I had an amazing time! I got general admission tickets and upgraded to a seat. There were cocktail tables and had cocktail waitresses that came around to each table. I did not have to get up and get my own drinks which worked out perfectly! I could enjoy the show more. This is definitely a place that I will visit again!

data.title: GREAT ATMOSPHERE & FUN TIME
data.text: Great atmosphere and great time for a smaller city. This live entertainment venue does it right. The experience you have on any given night or show will make you wanting to come back to Greensboro NC more often. That's 100%

data.title: General Admission - Too crowded!
data.text: First experience last night at CDEC for a Gregg Allman concert.  Way too many people for standing room General Admission, seemed like a safety concern.  $50+ for tickets (with the Ticketmaster fees), but not worth the sardine-like crowd on the floor. Beer and drinks with ice spilled underfoot on a slanted floor. Confusion over how to reserve available tables, call-back from the venue said there would be "about 30 tables on a first-come basis", but arriving early, all of the tables were reserved. Gregg Allman has a great band and the sound is good, but would not recommend General Admission to anyone or return to endure that again.  Balcony reserved looked nice, although much further away.  The "tron" screens set up everywhere all had a distant shot of the stage, might have been better if someone was manning a camera and could focus on the different musicians.  CDEC should consider setting up seating in the GA area for certain shows, or limit GA for a better concert experience.

data.title: Concert
data.text: A fun night.  The sound was good and we love this location.  Very little wait time to get drinks.  I found the bathrooms to be clean and staff friendly.  We will come here again.

data.title: Seriously? No seating?
data.text: We bought tickets to a Billy Joel tribute band  (through Groupon). I had never been to the CDEC, so wasn't sure what to expect. Image our surprise when it turns out the concert was all standing--let me repeat that, ALL STANDING. ALL EVENING. There are a few seats (maybe 30) in the one row balcony, but of course, the Groupon never gave us a choice. And the sound system was terrible. The drums were too loud, the bass guitar reverberated through my whole body. You couldn't hear the singer, sometimes you couldn't hear the brass section.  When I was 20, that would have been OK. But I'm not 20. And to top it all off, there was a gentleman SMOKING in the audience!  I will never go back to this venue--the seating sucked, the music was poorly amplified (TOO LOUD!!), and the smoking. We left before it was over.

data.title: Reminds you of House of Blues...but with seating!
data.text: Just saw the Floetry concert here and it was my first time at this venue! I will definitely come back.  There is only one women's bathroom on the first floor. Multiple stalls are on the upper floors - this is probably the only downside...but I still like the spot!

data.title: Great place to see live music!
data.text:
I have been to a few shows at the CDEC and each experience has been great.  We have had pew seats as well as balcony.  Not a bad seat in the house.  Have yet to purchase GA tickets on floor, but if you are looking for a club experience this place is great.
Servers are plentiful and your glass will not remain empty for long.
Some great acts have come though.
Most acts are all ages, so children are welcome.
Don't miss it.

data.title: Outstanding Concert Venue
data.text:
There must be another listing for this performance hall, so you may want to look for it.  I can't say enough postive things about it.  People are everything, and every staffer I had contact in was friendly and attentive.  The building is quite narrow.  It seems like it's no wider than your local multiplex theater.  There's a center aisle and end aisles in the lower level.  There's a balcony upstairs.  The acoustics were great.

It may not interest everybody, but at the back of the lower level is a two-sided bar area.  A full bar.  I know it forced the removal of several rows of seats, but it is a real treat to be able to have a beverage of your choice right at your seat.  They even have service at your seat right up until the show starts.
